1.「おお <cs_pchero>さんではありませんか。| まさか ここで お会いで: Oh, isn't it <cs_pchero>? I never thought|I'd see you here!

2.「王者のこてを必要とする 冒険者がいると| 不思議な声が心に響いたので 来てみた:
I came because a strange voice echoed in my|mind that there were adventurers in need of|Champion Gloves, and I came because|
|.

3.「メギストリスを危機から救った 恩人である| <cs_pchero>さんの 導き: Let us go to the great King Epath to be guided|by <cs_pchero>, the benefactors who saved|Megistris from peril.

4.「像に宿りし エパト王の魂よ。| メギストリスを守る 偉大な王よ。| どうか 我: O spirit of King Epaphat, who inhabits the|statue. O great king who defends Megistris.|Please answer my call!

5.<center>我は エパト王……。|かつて このメギストリスを統治し|長きに渡: I am King Epath, who once ruled Megistris, and|who has watched over Megistris for many years.

6.<center>我が問いに答え 王としての資質を示せ。|さすれば 貴公を|始まり: Answer my questions and show me your qualities|as a king. Then I will accept you as my guide|to the Beginning Tower.

8.<center>……我が末裔に問う。|国とは いかなるものか？: I ask my descendants. What is a country?

9.「国…………。| 国とは そこに住む者の幸せを守るものです。: A country... a country protects the well-being|of those who live there.

10.<center>……ならば さらに問う。|王とは いかなるものか？: Then I ask you a further question. What is a|king?

11.「王とは 自己を犠牲にしてでも| 国の発展に 尽くす者のことです。: A king is a man who's devoted to the|betterment of his country, even at the cost of|his own life.

12.<center>……なるほど。貴公の考えは わかった。|だが 王者のこてが眠る塔: I see. I see your point. But to pave the way|to the Tower where the Champion Gloves rests,|you'll have to pay a steep price.

13.<center>代償とは すなわち|王自らの命を ささげること……。: The price, in other words, is to give the|king's own life...

14.<center>貴公のそばにいる その者は この世界を救う|王者となるに ふさわ: The man by your side is worthy to be the|champion who will save this world.

15.<center>貴公は 先ほど 国のため|そこに住む 人々の幸せを守るため|自己: You said earlier that a king sacrifices|himself to protect the happiness of his|country and its people.

16.<center>ならば 世界のため 人々の幸せのために|自らの死をもって 王者の:
Then, for the sake of the world and the|happiness of others, you must die to pave the|way for a champion. End your life here and|
|now.

20.「私の身に宿る命は 父と母が命がけで| 私に与えてくれた命。: The life I carry in my body is the life my|parents risked their lives to give me.

21.「そして 私は この命で| この国の人々を守っていくのです。: And I will use this life to protect the people|of this country.

22.「ご先祖さまの おっしゃることとはいえ| そんな要求を のむわけにはいきません。: We cannot accept such a request, even though|our ancestors told us to do so. Please show me|other conditions.

24.<center>まこと 現世の王に ふさわしき答えなり。|その若さで そこまで国:
A fitting answer for the king of this world.|It's admirable that you think so much of your|country at such a young age. Now the people|
|have been blessed with a good king.

26.<center>貴公を 正当なる王として認めよう。|我が子孫よ……メギストリスを: I now proclaim you the rightful king. My|offspring you will take care of Megistris.

27.「<cs_pchero>さん。ぼくが導き手として| 始まりの塔への道を 開きます: <cs_pchero>. I will lead the way to the|Beginning Tower.

28.「その玉を 像に掲げてみてください。: Raise that ball up to the statue.

29.<cs_pchero>は|エパト王の像に 次元渡りの玉を掲げた！: <cs_pchero> raised the Dimensional Jewel|over the King Epat Statue!

32.<center>しかし 王者が必要とされる時代が|ふたたび 訪れようとは……。|: But I never thought that the time would come|again when a champion would be needed...|Resting time never lasts, does it?

33.<center>王にも王者にも 恵まれている時代だ。|いかなる困難が訪れようとも:
It is a time blessed with kings and champions.|Whatever difficulties may come our way, I|believe that those of this age will overcome|
|them.

35.<center>よくぞ 守護鬼を倒した。|貴公こそが 現世の王者にふさわしい。: Well done, you have defeated the guardian|demon. You are worthy to be the champion of|this world.

37.<center>まがまがしい邪気に 感づかれる前に|この塔は ふたたび 閉ざすと: I will close this Tower once again before the|evil spirit that is so deceitful can sense it.|I will also keep the Dimensional Jewel.

38.なんと <cs_pchero>が持っていた|次元渡りの玉が 消えていった！: Oh my god, the Dimensional Jewel that|<cs_pchero> was holding has vanished!

40.<cs_pchero>のもとに 天から|光に包まれた武具が 降りてきた。: Armaments wrapped in light came down from the|heavens to <cs_pchero>.
